channel.title: Asides on Deuts Log
channel.description: Recent content in Asides on Deuts Log

item.title: Windows 11 QEMU/KVM Installation Guide in Linux Including TPM and Secure Boot
item.description:
Windows 11 QEMU/KVM Installation Guide in Linux Including TPM and Secure Boot

This video is a tutorial on how to install Windows 11 in a QEMU/KVM Virtual Machine. This is based on Ubuntu 24.04 as the host Linux system, using a Linux compatible Laptop (Lenovo Thinkpad X1 Carbon 2025), with a TPM emulator and UEFI/Secure Boot emulator.
item.content:encoded:
Windows 11 QEMU/KVM Installation Guide in Linux Including TPM and Secure Boot

This video is a tutorial on how to install Windows 11 in a QEMU/KVM Virtual Machine. This is based on Ubuntu 24.04 as the host Linux system, using a Linux compatible Laptop (Lenovo Thinkpad X1 Carbon 2025), with a TPM emulator and UEFI/Secure Boot emulator.

item.title: JSON Crack
item.description:
JSON Crack

JSON Crack Editor is a tool for visualizing into graphs, analyzing, editing, formatting, querying, transforming and validating JSON, CSV, YAML, XML, and more.
item.content:encoded:
JSON Crack

JSON Crack Editor is a tool for visualizing into graphs, analyzing, editing, formatting, querying, transforming and validating JSON, CSV, YAML, XML, and more.

item.title: Anchor notes
item.description:
Anchor notes

Offline first, self hostable note taking application. Anchor focuses on speed, privacy, simplicity, and reliability across mobile and web. Notes are stored locally, editable offline, and synced across devices when online.
item.content:encoded:
Anchor notes

Offline first, self hostable note taking application. Anchor focuses on speed, privacy, simplicity, and reliability across mobile and web. Notes are stored locally, editable offline, and synced across devices when online.

item.title: Any Sync Bundle
item.description:
Any Sync Bundle

any-sync-bundle is a prepackaged, all-in-one self-hosted server for Anytype – a local-first, privacy-focused alternative to Notion. It merges all official Anytype sync modules into a single binary for simplified deployment. Think of it as “K3s for Any Sync”.
item.content:encoded:
Any Sync Bundle

any-sync-bundle is a prepackaged, all-in-one self-hosted server for Anytype – a local-first, privacy-focused alternative to Notion. It merges all official Anytype sync modules into a single binary for simplified deployment. Think of it as “K3s for Any Sync”.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01KF17MDEXJY4M271WB7FC372B
item.description:
@royal You can use multiple family members access and work on the same #ActualBudget budget file. However, there’s no indicator who added/edited what, regardless if you have OpenID enabled.

OpenID is necessary if you want different people to have different login credentials. But I think this is useful only if you want to restrict access of different users across different budget files.
item.content:encoded:
@royal You can use multiple family members access and work on the same #ActualBudget budget file. However, there’s no indicator who added/edited what, regardless if you have OpenID enabled.

OpenID is necessary if you want different people to have different login credentials. But I think this is useful only if you want to restrict access of different users across different budget files.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01KF16JW6AS6TMFTHJRJKKNDQ5
item.description: Looking at the support channel of #ActualBudget on Discord, a lot of issues is about the bank sync. Is this really the selling point of Actual? Do you really have a lot of bank or credit card transactions that you can’t keep up with just manually encoding them? If that’s the case, can’t you just download the csv, transform them accordingly and upload to Actual instead?
item.content:encoded: Looking at the support channel of #ActualBudget on Discord, a lot of issues is about the bank sync. Is this really the selling point of Actual? Do you really have a lot of bank or credit card transactions that you can’t keep up with just manually encoding them? If that’s the case, can’t you just download the csv, transform them accordingly and upload to Actual instead?

item.title: Discussion on Pangolin and Crowdsec Issue
item.description:
Discussion on Pangolin and Crowdsec Issue

This is a reddit discussion about the issue and some helpful links on the workaround for Pangolin to play nicely with Crowdsec.
item.content:encoded:
Discussion on Pangolin and Crowdsec Issue

This is a reddit discussion about the issue and some helpful links on the workaround for Pangolin to play nicely with Crowdsec.
